challenge.description: Presence of MnO second phase in all samples.
challenge.impact: The MnO second phase can negatively affect the purity and performance of the electrode material.

solution.methodology: Solid-state reaction with controlled firing temperature and substitution of manganese with titanium.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully reduced the MnO second phase, as confirmed by structural analysis and Rietveld refinement results.

evidence.source: Results and discussion section, Table 1, and Figures 1-3.
evidence.data: Rietveld refinement results showed lower R values when titanium was located in the 16d-site, indicating improved structural agreement.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with cubic unit cell; titanium substitution increases lattice constants.
context.experimental_conditions: Firing temperatures of 850°C and 1100°C in air.
context.application_relevance: Improved structural and chemical stability for use in lithium secondary battery cathodes.

challenge.description: Decreased electrical conductivity with increasing titanium content.
challenge.impact: Lower electrical conductivity can reduce the efficiency of the electrode material in battery applications.

solution.description: Optimization of titanium content to balance structural stability and electrical conductivity.
solution.methodology: Impedance spectroscopy to analyze contributions from grain, grain boundary, and electrode effects.
solution.effectiveness: Identified optimal titanium content that minimizes resistance while maintaining structural integrity.

evidence.data: Impedance spectra showed increased grain boundary resistance with higher titanium content, but grain resistance remained relatively stable.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with interconnected interstitial spaces; titanium substitution affects ionic radii and lattice parameters.
context.experimental_conditions: Room temperature impedance measurements in air.
context.application_relevance: Critical for achieving high-performance cathode materials in lithium secondary batteries.
